block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

CHAPPAQUA -- Saw Mill Summer Theater presents ''The Who's Tommy.'' Tonight and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Through Aug. 12. Tickets: $16. Chappaqua Library. (914) 923-7529.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

CHAPPAQUA -- Saw Mill Summer Theater presents ''The Who's Tommy.'' Tonight and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Through Aug. 12. Tickets: $16. Chappaqua Library. (914) 923-7529.

CROTON FALLS -- Staged reading of ''Unexpected Man'' by Yasmina Reza. Today at 4 p.m. Staged reading of three short plays adapted from the book ''Blonde'' by Joyce Carol Oates. Friday and next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 4 p.m. Donation: $12. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road, off Route 22. (914) 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- ''Sound of Music.'' Matinee and evening performances Wednesdays through Sundays. Through September. Tickets: $46 to $66, including dinner. Discounts available for students, people 62 and older and children on selected performances. (Show only, this Wednesday evening. Tickets: $30; children 16 and younger, $20. Limit of two children accompanying each adult.) Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival presenting ''Measure for Measure.'' Tonight at 6. ''Taming of the Shrew.'' Wednesday through Friday at 7 p.m. and next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Tickets: $19 to $30, with discounts available for students, people 65 and older and children, except Saturday evenings. Picnicking encouraged before shows. (Picnic dinners available by reservation. Cost: $16 and $18.) Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.
MAMARONECK -- ''A Couple of Blaguards,'' comedy by Frank McCourt and Malachy McCourt. Today at 2 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $28; matinee, $23. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Comedy of Errors.'' Tonight at 8. Free. Picnicking encouraged, with sale of refreshments. Lawn of Fleetwood Stage, 44 Wildcliff Drive. (914) 654-8533.
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''The Heiress,'' based on Henry James novel. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $5. Iona College. (914) 633-2606.

SCARSDALE -- ''Pippin,'' performed by Scarsdale Summer Music Theater. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 12. Tickets: $15; students, people 65 and older and children, $12. Scarsdale High School. (914) 472-1727.

THORNWOOD -- ''Crazy for You,'' Gershwin musical presented by Mount Pleasant Community Theater. Today at 3 p.m. and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and people 62 and older, $12. (Meet-the-cast pizza dinner after today's matinee. Additional $5.) Westlake High School. (914) 997-0597.
Music and Dance
BRONXVILLE -- John Amoroso Jazz Combo. Presented by Eastchester Arts Council. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Morange Memorial Park.

BREWSTER -- Doansburg Chamber Ensemble presenting Christine Smith, flutist; Mark Delpriora, guitarist, and Deborah Horne, soprano. Works by Copland, Handel and others. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $9; students and people 62 and older, $8. Trinity Lutheran Church. (845) 228-4167.

CROMPOND -- Northern Westchester Symphony Orchestra, with vocalists, Janet Hopkins, Gary Yates and Ellen Bullinger; Gabriel Tevan, conductor. Works by Bizet, Strauss, Verdi and Gershwin. Friday at 8 p.m. Rain or shine. Free. Martha Guinsberg Pavilion, Baron de Hirsch Road, off Route 202. (914) 736-9533.
DOBBS FERRY -- Latin rhythms by Bronx Horns. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (914) 631-1000.
EASTCHESTER -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Lawn of Eastchester Town Hall, Mill Road. (914) 723-7171.

FORDHAM -- ''Fathers and Sons,'' music of J. S. Bach, C. P. E. Bach, Alessandro Scarlatti and Domenico Scarlatti by Elaine Comparone, harpsichordist. Today at 4 p.m. Free. McGinley Center, Fordham University at Bronx Rose Hill Campus. (718) 601-7399.

GARRISON -- ''Dances With Nature,'' Clare Capossela performs Hawaiian dances of nature, birds, stars and flowers. Next Saturday at 7 p.m. Donation: $5; children, $3; members, $1 less. Manitoga, Route 9D, two miles south of Route 403. (845) 424-3812.
GOLDENS BRIDGE -- Folk dancing led by Rose and Meir Beer. Fridays at 8:30 p.m. Through Aug. 18. Admission: $6 each. Goldens Bridge Community Center Barn, Hall Avenue. (914) 232-1862.

KATONAH -- Brief recital and tour of house museum. Wednesdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $11. (914) 232-5035. Sara Bitlloch, violinist, and Benjamin Hochman, pianist, perform pieces by Janacek, Brahms and Beethoven. Thursday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. (914) 232-1252. (With formal tea and tour of house museum at 1:30 p.m. $29.50. Reservations. (914) 232-8076.) ''Today's Music Tonight: From Sea to Shining Sea''; Manuel Barrueco, guitarist; Ransom Wilson, flutist, and Caramoor Virtuosi Quartet, playing Daugherty's tip-of-the-hat composition to Lucy and Desi and other music ranging from Appalachian to soul train. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. Jazz festival ''Bird Lives!'' Next Saturday, featuring Sam Rivers Trio at 2; Hilton Ruiz Trio with Chris Potter at 3:15; Steve Lacy and Mal Waldron at 4:30; Paul Motian, Joe Lovano and Bill Frisell at 5:45 (dinner break at 6:45) and James Moody Quartet with Phil Woods, Charles McPherson and Brian Lynch at 8 p.m. Tickets: $40. Vermeer Quartet with Vladimir Feltsman, pianist. Works by Haydn, Smetana and Brahms. Next Sunday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $25 and $35. (914) 232-1252. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road, off Route 22.
KATONAH -- Blues by harpist and vocalist, Little Sammy Davis. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Garden of Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

MAMARONECK -- Hot Latin music presented by Frank Valdes Quartet. Sponsored by Village of Mamaroneck Council of the Arts. Tonight at 7, with pinata workshop at 6 p.m. (Rain date, tomorrow.) Free. Harbor Island Park. (914) 777-7722.
MAMARONECK -- John Gorka with Stacey Earle. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $24. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

MOUNT VERNON -- Bronx Horns present a tribute to Tito Puente. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. (914) 631-1000. Westchester Chamber Orchestra, with soprano, Virginia Herrera. Concert, including opera, ragtime, Celtic and popular music. Next Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Free. (914) 235-6528. Hartley Park, Gramatan and East Lincoln Avenues. (Rain location for both concerts; Allen Memorial Church, 132 Crary Avenue.)
NYACK -- John Ellington Blair and his jazz violin quintet. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Hopper House Art Center, 82 North Broadway. (845) 358-0774.

NYACK -- ''Musical Conversation With Elaine Stritch and She's Talkin' to Larry Grossman.'' Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35 and $40. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

PAWLING -- Paperboys in concert. Thursday at 8 p.m. Bill Miller and also Garnet Rogers. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $17.50 each; members, $15. Celtic band, Lunasa. Next Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $20; members, $17.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

RIVERDALE -- ''Fathers and Sons,'' Elaine Comparone, harpsichordist, performing music by J. S. Bach, C. P. E. Bach, Alessandro Scarlatti and Domenico Scarlatti. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Rockwood Drive Circle, Van Cortlandt Park. (718) 601-7399.
RYE -- Dance to the music of Westchester Swing Band. Friday at 7:30 to 11 p.m. Parking: $4. Boardwalk of Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.
SCARSDALE -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Chase Park. (914) 723-7171.
SCARSDALE -- Summer sing-in of Mozart's ''Mass in C minor''; John King, conductor. Presented by Westchester Chorale. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Admission: $8. Scarsdale High School. (914) 693-0990.

VALHALLA -- New York Philharmonic; Mikko Franck, guest conductor. Works by Bernstein, Gershwin, Alexander Arutunian and Stravinsky. Next Saturday at 8 p.m., followed by fireworks. Grounds of Westchester Community College. (Rain site, County Center in White Plains, with reserved tickets.) Free. (914) 242-7275.
WHITE PLAINS -- White Plains Recreation Pops Band; Alfred A. Renino, director. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Gille Park. (Rain site, Highlands Middle School.) (914) 422-1336.
Art
CHAPPAQUA -- ''Dialogues in the Garden; Figures in Cement,'' sculpture by Jo-Ann Brody. Through August. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
COLD SPRING -- Photography of historic houses throughout Putnam County. Through August. Putnam County Historical Society and Foundry School Museum, 63 Chestnut Street. (845) 265-4010.
HARRISON -- Exhibition of art by Lawrence Flanagan. Opening reception Wednesday from 7 to 8 p.m. Through Aug. 25. Harrison Public Library, Bruce Avenue. (914) 835-0324.

KATONAH -- Panel discussion of making art in relationship to environments, by sculptors, Emily Feinstein, Nene Humphrey and Grace Knowlton. Today at 2 p.m. Museum admission only, $3. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.
LARCHMONT -- Oils by Joan Tait and paintings by Mara Attina. Through Aug. 29. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.

NORTH SALEM -- ''Modern Prints -- Ancient Fans,'' exhibition of works by 100 contemporary printmakers, assembled in Japan into traditional folding fans. ''Portraits by Carl Van Vechten and John Gruen'' of Georgia O'Keeffe, Salvador Dali, Alexander Calder and other artists. Wednesdays through Saturdays from noon to 4 p.m. Admission: $4; people 62 and older, $3; children, free. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, top of Deveau Road, off June Road. (914) 669-5033.
NYACK -- Relief sculpture by Dominican Sister Adele Myers. Reception today from 2 to 6 p.m. Through next Sunday. Piermont Flywheel Gallery, 223 Ash Street. (845) 359-1573.

PURCHASE -- ''Whitfield Lovell: Portrayals,'' ''Welded! Sculpture of the 20th Century,'' ''Recent Acquisitions: Gifts From the Lawrence Gussman Collection of African Art,'' ''Selections From the Roy R. Neuberger Collection,'' ''Object and Intellect: African Art From the Permanent Collection'' and ''Ancient Civilizations: The Roy R. Neuberger Collection.'' Tuesdays through Fridays from 10 a.m. to 4 and Saturdays and Sundays from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $2; children, free. Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

PURCHASE -- PepsiCo sculpture gardens, featuring sculptures by Alexander Calder, Henry Moore, David Wynne, Rodin, Alberto Giacometti and others, set among fountains, manicured lawns, flower beds and wooded areas. Daily from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. PepsiCo Headquarters, Anderson Hill Road. (914) 253-2000.
SHRUB OAK -- ''Scenes of Summer,'' photography by Charles Francis Vigliotti. Through August. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 Main Street. (914) 245-5262.
SPRING VALLEY -- ''Reflections,'' photography by Barbara Yaeger. Opens Tuesday. Through August. Finkelstein Memorial Library, 24 Chestnut Street. (845) 352-5700.
TARRYTOWN -- Drawings, paintings and mixed media by members of the art program at Neighborhood House. Opens Tuesday. Through August. Warner Library, 121 North Broadway. (914) 631-7734.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''Westchester in the Movies,'' photography from D. W. Griffith's ''Way Down East,'' ''Orphans of the Storm'' and ''America'' and photography and posters of award-winning films with Westchester locations, including ''Goodbye Columbus,'' ''The Age of Innocence'' and ''Ragtime.'' Through Labor Day. Museum gallery of White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.

YONKERS -- ''A Midsummer Night's Dream,'' two exhibits featuring works depicting landscapes or using natural materials. Works by Sheila Benedis, Eleanor Goldstein and Catherine L. Wells at Will Library, 1500 Central Park Avenue. Works by Vivian Bergenthal, Gregory Paul Henne, Cheryl Jelonek Kawalerski and Terry Kessler Schwarz at Getty Square Branch, 7 Main Street. (914) 337-1500.
Lectures

MAMARONECK -- Investors' tax-trimming strategies are discussed by Julian Block. Sponsored by Larchmont-Mamaroneck Center for Continuing Education. Friday at 8:30 a.m. Cost: $25. Registration. Mamaroneck High School. (914) 698-3255.

MOUNT VERNON -- Examination of the life and work of Edward Gay, prominent 19th-century landscape painter, buried at St. Paul's. Thursday at 11 a.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Readings by novelist, Joseph Freda, and poet, Sabra Loomis. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Admission: $5; members, $3. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
Potpourri

BREWSTER -- Heirlooms road show, with appraisal of antiques, collectibles and other items of value. Presented by Landmarks Preservation Society. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Cost: $5 an item; three or more items, $4 each. Walter Brewster House, 43 Oak Street. (845) 279-4078.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Leisurely 18-mile bike tour of New Rochelle. Benefiting Westchester County Crimestoppers. Today at 9 a.m. Cost: $25. Begins and ends at New Roc City, Main and Huguenot Streets.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Exhibit of historic photos of New Rochelle. Through Friday. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
NORTH SALEM -- Country auction, with fresh produce, flea market and refreshments. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Free admission. St. James Episcopal Church, Route 116 and June Road.
SOMERS -- Walking tour of Lasdon Park, Arboretum and Veterans Memorial. Next Sunday from 2 to 3 p.m. Cost: $3. Registration. Route 35. (914) 232-9147.

TARRYTOWN -- Exhibition of the Tarrytown Y.M.C.A.'s history, members and activities, from 1902 to present. Featuring photography, artifacts, sports equipment and memorabilia. Tuesdays through Thursdays and Saturdays from 2 to 4 p.m. Through Nov. 15. Free. Historical Society of Sleepy Hollow and Tarrytown, 1 Grove Street. (914) 631-8374.
VALHALLA -- Polish heritage celebration. Today from 1 to 7 p.m. Indian heritage celebration. Next Sunday from noon to 8 p.m. Kensico Dam Plaza, north end of Bronx River Parkway. (914) 242-7275.
YONKERS -- Arab heritage celebration. Today from 3 to 8 p.m. Parking: $3.50. Tibbetts Brook Park. (914) 242-7275.

YONKERS -- Hike the northern loop (5.5 miles) of Black Rock Forest. Bring bathing suit and plan to stop for swim at pond. Next Sunday at 9 a.m. Free. Meet at Beczak Environmental Education Center, 21 Alexander Street for car pooling. (914) 376-0859.
Children

FORDHAM -- ''Summer Safari 2000.'' Today, with Dancers of India performing at noon, 2 and 4 p.m.; storytelling about the animals of India at 11:30 a.m. and 1:30 and 3:30 p.m.; face painting of children 3 and older into animals at 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. and family science fair with hands-on activities throughout the zoo from 11:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Brazilian music and dance. Next Saturday and Sunday at noon, 2 and 4 p.m.; stories about South American wildlife at 11:30 a.m. and 1:30 and 3:30 p.m.; face painting of children 3 and older into South American animals from 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m., penguin mobile craft workshops from 11:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and family science activities from 11:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. All free with general admission: $9; people 65 and older and children 2 through 12, $5. Bronx Zoo. (718) 367-1010.
ELMSFORD -- ''Charlotte's Web,'' musical presented by Westco Productions. Tomorrow and Tuesday at 9 and 11 a.m. Show only, $12. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

KATONAH -- Children 7 and older paint big pictures of the great outdoors. Wednesday and Aug. 9 from 1 to 3 p.m. Cost: $15 each; members, $12. Registration. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

MOUNT VERNON -- Historic games, toys and songs for children 6 through 10. Tuesday from 10:30 to 11:15 a.m. Re-enactment of 1733 election that led to freedom of religion in the American colonies, with children's activities. Wednesday from 12:15 to 1 p.m. Church bell tower tour. Friday at 3 p.m. All free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Magic show with John Turdo. Wednesday at 2 p.m. Free. Hudson Park, Pelham Road. (718) 823-7706.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Italian songs and dances, with Nancy Corvino and Friends. Program for children 6 and older and adults. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
NORTH SALEM -- Terrarium workshop for children 6 through 12. Next Saturday from 2:30 to 3:45 p.m. Cost: $8; members, $6. Registration. Hammond Museum, top of Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.
OSSINING -- The film ''Stuart Little.'' Friday at 2 p.m. Free tickets available at library. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. (914) 941-2416.

OSSINING -- Outdoor family games needing no equipment. Friday from 7 to 8:30 p.m. Cost: $8; members, $6. Registration. Meet at nature center of Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.
RYE -- Fireworks display. Wednesday and Friday at 9:15 p.m. Parking: $4. Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.

RYE -- ''Awesome Arachnids,'' children 8 through 10 learn about spiders and make insect catchers to take home. Next Saturday from 1 to 2:30 p.m. Cost: $12; members, $8. Registration required. Rye Nature Center. (914) 967-5150.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Tour the Tarrytown Lighthouse. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Free. Meet in parking lot of Kingsland Point Park. (914) 242-7275.
SOMERS -- Family festival with pony rides, music and other activities. Next Sunday from noon to 4 p.m. Free admission, but a small charge for pony rides. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.
TARRYTOWN -- Exhibition of Raggedy Ann and Andy dolls, on loan from Lee Kimmel. Opens Tuesday. Through August. Warner Library, 121 North Broadway. (914) 631-7734.

TARRYTOWN -- ''From a Child's Perspective,'' educational tours of Washington Irving's home, with tales of Sunnyside's former child residents, interactive scavenger hunt, display of period toys and hands-on activities. Thursdays from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 5 through 17, $4. Off Route 9. (914) 591-8763.
YONKERS -- Westchester County diving championships. Tomorrow and Tuesday from 3 p.m. to finish. Admission: $4.75; children 5 through 11, $3; younger children, free. Sprain Ridge Pool. (914) 242-6352.

YONKERS -- Lunch-time stories for children 3 and older. Bring bag lunch. Tomorrow at noon. Pajama-time stories and songs. Wednesdays at 6:30 p.m. Through August. Will Library, 1500 Central Park Avenue. Summer film festival. Mondays at 2 p.m. Through Aug. 21. Getty Square Branch of Yonkers Public Library. (914) 337-1500.

YONKERS -- View the planetarium show ''Guided by the Sky'' and make your own star chart. Today at 1:30 p.m. $1 and museum admission additional $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. ''The Sky Tonight.'' Fridays at 7 p.m., with free tickets available at front desk beginning at 6:30. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
